question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::new()] [Integer overflow] Can an attacker provide malicious CacheConfig values where max_cache_size or target_cache_size overflow when cast to i64 in metric setting, causing incorrect cache behavior or panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::new()] [Configuration bypass] Can max_cache_size be set to a value smaller than target_cache_size, breaking cache GC logic assumptions and causing infinite loops or incorrect eviction? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::new()] [Memory exhaustion] Can an attacker cause the system to initialize with an extremely large max_cache_size value leading to memory exhaustion and node crashes when the cache fills up? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::maybe_gc()] [Race condition] Can concurrent calls to maybe_gc() while file_store_version is being updated via AtomicU64::fetch_add() cause inconsistent cache eviction where transactions are removed but start_version doesn't advance correctly? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::maybe_gc()] [Panic condition] The unwrap() on pop_front() assumes transactions exist when start_version < file_store_version - can race conditions cause the VecDeque to be empty while this condition is true, triggering a panic and node crash? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::maybe_gc()] [Integer underflow] Can cache_size underflow if transaction.encoded_len() is incorrectly calculated or manipulated, leading to cache_size wrapping to a huge value and breaking GC logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::maybe_gc()] [State inconsistency] Can the cache be in a state where start_version advances but cache_size is not properly decremented, causing cache size metrics to diverge from actual memory usage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::maybe_gc()] [Version manipulation] If file_store_version is maliciously decreased via fetch_max with a smaller value, can GC stop functioning properly since the condition start_version < file_store_version would never be met? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::maybe_gc()] [Livelock] Can the GC loop between lines 68-74 enter an infinite state where cache_size never goes below target_cache_size even after all evictable transactions are removed, causing the thread to hang? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::maybe_gc()] [Metric inconsistency] Are CACHE_SIZE and CACHE_START_VERSION metrics updated atomically with the actual cache state, or can observers see inconsistent metrics during GC operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::put_transactions()] [Integer overflow] Can the sum of encoded_len() values overflow usize when adding many large transactions, causing cache_size to wrap and break GC logic? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::put_transactions()] [Memory exhaustion] Can an attacker send extremely large malformed transactions that pass initial validation but have huge encoded_len() values, filling the cache and causing OOM crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::put_transactions()] [Cache poisoning] Can duplicate or out-of-order transactions be inserted into the cache, breaking the assumption that cache contains continuous version ranges? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::put_transactions()] [Version gap] If transactions with gaps in version numbers are inserted (e.g., versions 100-105 then 110-115), does the cache correctly handle requests for missing versions 106-109? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::put_transactions()] [Metric overflow] When setting CACHE_END_VERSION on line 89, can start_version + transactions.len() overflow i64 causing incorrect metric values or panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::put_transactions()] [Race condition] Can concurrent put_transactions() calls interleave, inserting transactions in wrong order and breaking cache version continuity assumptions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::get_transactions()] [Integer overflow] Can the skip calculation (start_version - self.start_version) overflow or panic if start_version is less than self.start_version due to concurrent start_version updates? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::get_transactions()] [Race condition] Between checking start_version < self.start_version at line 108 and the skip operation at line 117, can concurrent GC advance start_version causing out-of-bounds access? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/data_manager.rs] [Function: Cache::get_transactions()] [AtomicU64 race] Can fetch_add on file_store_version at line 131 race with fetch_max in update_file_store_version_in_cache, causing version to jump forward unexpectedly?
